ARABIC: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءَ أَحَدَهُمُ ٱلْمَوْتُ قَالَ رَبِّ ٱرْجِعُونِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When death comes to one of them, he says, 'My Lord, send me back again.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (But the unbelievers will persist) until when death comes to one of them he will say: "O Lord, send me back again
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (They shall persist in their deeds) until when death comes to anyone of them he will say: "My Lord, send me back to the world
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When death approaches one of the unbelievers, he says, "Lord, send me back again
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Until, when death comes to one* of them, he says, “O my Lord, send me back!” (The disbelievers)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Until, when death comes to one of them, he says: "My Lord! Send me back,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Until when death overtakes one of them, he says: Send me back, my Lord, send me back;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Till, when death comes to one of them, he says, 'My Lord, return me;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Until, when death cometh unto one of them, he saith: My Lord! Send me back,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When death comes to any of them, he says, "My Lord, send me back
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: lt ceaseth not until when death cometh to one of them, and he saith: my Lord! send me back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When death comes to one of them, he says, ‘My Lord! Take me back,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (In Falsehood will they be) Until, when death comes to one of them, he says: "O my Lord! send me back (to life),-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Until, when death comes to one of them (those who join partners with Allah), he says: "My Lord! Send me back,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Until, when death comes to one of them he says: 'My Lord, let me go back,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Until, when death comes to one of them, he says, “My Lord, send me back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [For such is the state of the disbelievers], until, when death comes to one of them, he says, "My Lord, send me back
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:99] Until (hattā is for inceptiveness) when death comes to one of them, and he sees his place in the Fire and his [would-be] place in Paradise, had he been a believer, he says, ‘My Lord! Send me back (arji‘ūn, the plural [person] is [used] to indicate the gravity [of the plea]),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Until, when death) the angels of death and his helpers (cometh unto one of them) i.e. the disbelievers of Mecca, (he saith: My Lord! Send me back) to the life of the world,
